pullrequest.title: Fix code check and test broken by PR 1622

content.raw:
After some discussion with @hsu I decided that the failures of `math::clamp` were originally due to precision issues with passing the raw number "1" or "1.0" to `clamp`, and the bounds should instead be declared as doubles. I reverted the test expectations in 3145df3 and all tests pass. I also added checks using `Vector3::Correct` to ensure that no `nan` or `inf` values are present in the output vectors.

bf7c68a removes the warnings and checks that are redundant with `math::clamp`.
content.html:
After some discussion with @hsu I decided that the failures of math::clamp were originally due to precision issues with passing the raw number "1" or "1.0" to clamp, and the bounds should instead be declared as doubles. I reverted the test expectations in 3145df3 and all tests pass. I also added checks using Vector3::Correct to ensure that no nan or inf values are present in the output vectors.

bf7c68a removes the warnings and checks that are redundant with math::clamp.
